title: Israeli Military Strikes Near Beirut, Saying Hezbollah Was the Target
description: The attack raised concerns that the cease-fire that ended a war between Israel and Lebanese militants might be in jeopardy.
author: Ephrat Livni

title: With a Bounty on His Head, a Critic of China Runs in Canada’s Election
description: After Joe Tay set up a run for Parliament, China issued a warrant for his arrest and coordinated online attacks on his candidacy.
author: Norimitsu Onishi

title: Driver plows vehicle into crowd at Filipino street festival in Vancouver, killing 11 people - PBS
description: Driver plows vehicle into crowd at Filipino street festival in Vancouver, killing 11 people  PBSLapu Lapu killings: Suspect charged with multiple counts of second-degree murder in Vancouver  CBCSuspect charged with murder in Vancouver festival attack, court documents show  The Globe and MailAt Least 11 People Killed After Car Plows Into Vancouver Filipino Festival  The New York TimesDriver charged with 8 counts of murder in Vancouver's Lapu Lapu Day tragedy  Vancouver Sun

title: More than 100 immigrants detained at an illegal after-hours nightclub in Colorado - AP News
description: More than 100 immigrants detained at an illegal after-hours nightclub in Colorado  AP NewsThe DEA says 114 immigrants in the U.S. illegally were arrested at a Colorado nightclub  NPRMore than 100 people detained after federal raid in Colorado Springs  The Guardian“We are not going to accept drug trafficking and prostitution in our cities”: DEA RMFD on underground nightclub bust in Colorado Springs  FOX21 News ColoradoOver 200 people detained, including military members, at unlicensed nightclub in Colorado, DEA says  AOL.com

title: "No Terror Link": Canada Cops On Vancouver Car Rampage That Killed 11
description: Canadian police have detained a 30-year-old man after a car rammed into a street party during a Filipino cultural celebration in Vancouver on Saturday, killing at least eleven people.

title: 40 Dead, Over 1,000 Injured In Iran Port Fire, Blast Heard 50 Km Away: 10 Points
description: Smoke shrouded Iran's largest commercial port and surrounding areas as a fire following a major blast killed 40 people and injured more than 1,000 so far. Strong winds posed hindrances to firefighting operations.

title: Trump says Columbus Day will now just be Columbus Day
A Common Pill May Shorten Life Expectancy by Nearly 6 Years, According to Doctors
Americans are getting flashbacks to 2008 as tariffs stoke recession fears
description: 'It's the old poors teaching the new poors,' said one content creator.

title: Trump floats tougher Russia sanctions, meets Zelenskyy for first time since Oval Office blowup
description: President Donald Trump's Truth Social post comes as he ramps up pressure on Russia and Ukraine to strike a deal to end their war.

title: 11 killed as vehicle drives through Vancouver festival crowd
description: Bystanders at the Vancouver Filipino community’s Lapu Lapu Day celebration helped apprehend a suspect. Police said they do not believe it was an act of terrorism.
author: Leo Sands, Niha Masih, Sammy Westfall, Rachel Pannett

title: At least 40 killed, hundreds injured in massive Iranian port explosion
description: Officials declared a public health emergency and warned of the spread of toxic pollutants through the air. The cause of the explosion is not yet clear.
author: Mikhail Klimentov, Susannah George, Niha Masih, Abbie Cheeseman

title: 20 yrs ago, 3 US presidents travelled together to mourn a pope. Not this time
description: In a stark contrast to the bipartisan unity displayed during Pope John Paul II's funeral, Donald Trump's attendance at Pope Francis' funeral highlighted the deep political divisions in America. Unlike George W. Bush, who invited Bill Clinton on Air Force One, Trump and Biden traveled separately.

title: Indian-origin executive takes over as Axiom Space CEO ahead of historic Indian astronaut mission
author: TOI World Desk

title: Meta faces Ghana lawsuits over impact of extreme content on moderators
description: Workers at contractor in Accra say they have suffered from depression and anxiety as a result of their work‘I didn’t eat or sleep’: a Meta moderator on his breakdownMeta is facing a second set of lawsuits in Africa over the psychological distress experienced by content moderators employed to take down disturbing social media content including depictions of murders, extreme violence and child sexual abuse.Lawyers are gearing up for court action against a company contracted by Meta, which owns Facebook and Instagram, after meeting moderators at a facility in Ghana that is understood to employ about 150 people.In the UK and Ireland, Samaritans can be contacted on freephone 116 123, or email jo@samaritans.org or jo@samaritans.ie. In the US, you can call or text the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 988, chat on 988lifeline.org, or text HOME to 741741 to connect with a crisis counselor. In Australia, the crisis support service Lifeline is 13 11 14. Other international helplines can be found at befrienders.org Continue reading...
author: Rachel Hall and Claire Wilmot in Nairobi

title: Weather tracker: thunderstorms lash Italy in aftermath of Storm Hans
description: Authorities warn of mudslides during intense rainfall, as Kenya is hit by deadly flash floodingEurope live – latest updatesAfter Storm Hans battered northern Italy in the runup to Easter, severe weather continued to lash much of the country this week. Since Tuesday, the conditions have triggered potent showers and thunderstorms, and yellow and orange weather warnings have been issued.With winds generally remaining light this week, the greatest concerns surround the risks from intense rainfall, as slow-moving heavy showers can deliver a prolonged downpour to a fairly localised area. The authorities have warned people to avoid high-risk areas such as roads with steep embankments amid a threat of flash flooding and mudslides. Continue reading...
author: Lauren Herdman for MetDesk

title: Community in shock as death toll in Vancouver car ramming attack rises to 11
description: The unidentified 30-year-old suspect had a history of mental health issues, according to Vancouver police.

title: Israel launches air strike on Beirut
description: Israel said it hit a Hezbollah missile store. The Lebanese presidency urged the US and France to press Israel to cease its attacks.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.
